page.description: The A5_SQLResultSetPreview() function displays up to 100 rows of data stored in a SQL::ResultSet object.
page.syntax: V a5_SQLResultSetPreview(P resultset [,C dialog_title [,L modal [,N width [,N height [,N maxrows [,C tablename [,L resultsetIsEmpty [,* OtherOptions [,* cn ]]]]]]]]])

argument.name: dialog_title
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". The title of the dialog box.

argument.name: modal
argument.description:
Logical. Optional. Default = .T. Sets the mode of the dialog box.
.T. = Modal
.F. = Modeless

argument.name: width
argument.description: Numeric. Optional. Default = 100. The width of the dialog box in characters.

argument.name: height
argument.description: Numeric. Optional. Default = 20. The height of the dialog box in lines.

argument.name: maxrows
argument.description: Numeric. Optional. Default = 100. Not changeable. The number of rows of data to display.

argument.name: tablename
argument.description: Optional. Default = "Table ". Used for the dialog title if Title is NULL. Character

section.description: Displays an Xdialog showing the data in an SQL Result set. If Cn (sql::connection) is passed in, the Resultset is freed immediately so as not to hold any server locks in place.

section.example: DIM conn as SQL::Connection DIM cs as C dim qry as SQL::Query dim SQL as C DIM rs as SQL::ResultSet cs = "{A5API='Access', A5Syntax='Access', FileName='C:\Program Files\a5v6\MDBFiles\Alphasports.mdb', UserName='Admin'}" SQL = "select * from customer" if (conn.Open(cs)) then if (qry.Parse(SQL)) then if (qry.Execute(conn)) then rs = qry.ResultSet A5_SQLResultSetPreview(rs) end if end if end if
